snippet: Navi Pillay, the United Nations’ high commissioner for human rights, said China’s suppression of the rights of Tibetans had driven them to “desperate forms of protest” like self-immolation.
abstract: United Nations says China’s suppression of the rights of Tibetans have driven them to protest with desperate forms like self-immolation.
lead_paragraph: Navi Pillay, the United Nations’ high commissioner for human rights, said China’s suppression of the rights of Tibetans had driven them to “desperate forms of protest” like self-immolation.

headline.seo: U.N. Official Decries China Treatment of Tibetans
headline.main: U.N. Rights Official Faults China on Tibetan Suppression
headline.print_headline: U.N. Rights Official Criticizes China’s Limits on Tibetans

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
